analysis:
# MAZDA EUNOS MOT History Analysis

OVERALL_SCORE: 63
OVERALL_RISK: MEDIUM
SYSTEMS_ANALYSED: 9
SYSTEMS_WITH_ISSUES: 8

SYSTEM_ANALYSIS_START

SYSTEM: Braking System
CATEGORY: BRAKING
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 12
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Recurring issues with brake pipes corrosion and worn brake discs
FINDINGS:
- Multiple instances of corroded brake pipes on nearside front, offside rear, and nearside rear (2025)
- Worn, pitted or scored brake discs noted in 2021 and 2024
- Brake pads wearing thin on rear wheels (noted in 2013, 2014, 2015)
- One instance of front brake binding (2020)
- Major defect: Excessively corroded rear brake pipe (2018)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Suspension Components
CATEGORY: SUSPENSION
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 8
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Recurring issues with suspension bushes, ball joints, and dust covers
FINDINGS:
- Offside front shock absorber has slightly worn bush (2025)
- Multiple ball joint dust covers deteriorated or excessively deteriorated (2014-2015)
- Upper and lower suspension arm ball joint dust covers issues on both front sides
- Progressive deterioration of suspension arm ball joint dust covers from 2014-2015
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Wheels and Tyres
CATEGORY: TYRES
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 6
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Issues with distorted wheel and recurring tyre wear problems
FINDINGS:
- Offside front road wheel slightly distorted (2025)
- Dangerous defect: Front road wheel more than one fixing loose (2018)
- Tyres worn close to legal limit on multiple occasions (2013)
- Nearside rear tyre had ply or cords exposed (2014)
- Recurring inner edge tyre wear on rear tyres (2011-2012)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Lighting System
CATEGORY: LIGHTING
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 7
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Recurring headlamp alignment and fog lamp issues
FINDINGS:
- Offside headlamp aim too low (2025, 2022)
- Both front headlamps aim too low (2015)
- Multiple failures related to rear fog lamp (2008, 2009, 2012, 2019)
- Rear fog lamp not working (2019) and emitting wrong color light (2009, 2012)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Emissions Control
CATEGORY: ENGINE
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 3
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Failed emissions tests showing exhaust gas content exceeding limits
FINDINGS:
- Exhaust carbon monoxide content after 2nd fast idle exceeding limits (2025)
- Exhaust hydrocarbon content after 2nd fast idle exceeding limits (2025)
- Exhaust carbon monoxide content at idle exceeding limits (2025)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Steering Components
CATEGORY: STEERING
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 3
RECENT_ACTIVITY: NO
SUMMARY: Issues with track rod end covers and steering rack gaiter
FINDINGS:
- Nearside steering rack gaiter split (2014)
- Track rod end ball joint dust covers excessively deteriorated on both sides (2015)
- Front wheel bearing with slight play (2015)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Fuel System
CATEGORY: FUEL
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 1
RECENT_ACTIVITY: YES
SUMMARY: Corroded fuel pipes
FINDINGS:
- Fuel pipes corroded (2025)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Vehicle Structure
CATEGORY: STRUCTURE
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 1
RECENT_ACTIVITY: NO
SUMMARY: Historical corrosion of rear sills
FINDINGS:
- Vehicle structure corroded to the extent that rigidity of assembly significantly reduced at rear sills (2018)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM: Cooling System
CATEGORY: COOLING
STATUS: WARNING
ISSUE_COUNT: 1
RECENT_ACTIVITY: NO
SUMMARY: Historical coolant leak
FINDINGS:
- Coolant leak noted (2012)
SYSTEM_END

SYSTEM_ANALYSIS_END

PATTERN_ANALYSIS_START
RECURRING_ISSUES:
- Headlamp alignment issues recurring in 2015, 2022, and 2025
- Brake pipe corrosion recurring and becoming more widespread over time
- Rear fog lamp issues recurring across multiple years (2008, 2009, 2012, 2019)
- Rear brake pads wearing thin noted multiple times (2013, 2014, 2015)

PROGRESSIVE_DETERIORATION:
- Suspension system deterioration with ball joint dust covers progressively worsening from 2014-2015
- Brake pipe corrosion started as advisory items but progressed to major defects

BULLETIN_CORRELATIONS:
- No technical bulletins available for correlation
PATTERN_ANALYSIS_END

RISK_FACTORS_START
- Emissions failure in 2025 indicates potential engine performance issues requiring attention
- Corroded brake pipes on multiple wheels represents potential safety risk
- Corroded fuel pipes could lead to fuel leaks and safety hazards
- Previous structural corrosion of rear sills could compromise safety in accident
- Loose wheel fixings (dangerous defect in 2018) indicates potential maintenance lapses
RISK_FACTORS_END

POSITIVE_FACTORS_START
- Vehicle has passed most recent MOT test after repairs
- Regular testing and maintenance observed throughout vehicle history
- Mileage increase relatively modest in recent years (approximately 13,000 miles over past 9 years)
POSITIVE_FACTORS_END

MAINTENANCE_INSIGHTS_START
- Brake system requires thorough inspection with particular attention to corroded pipes
- Emissions system needs diagnostic assessment and potential carburetor/fuel system service
- Suspension components should be checked for further deterioration of bushes and dust covers
- Vehicle is showing typical age-related corrosion that requires ongoing monitoring
- Front wheel alignment should be checked given recurring headlamp aim issues
MAINTENANCE_INSIGHTS_END

SUMMARY: This Mazda Eunos presents a moderate risk profile with several concerning issues across multiple vehicle systems. With 157,760 miles recorded, the vehicle shows expected wear for its age but has several recurring problems that require attention. Most concerning are the recent emissions failures, widespread brake pipe corrosion, and historical structural issues. The brake system shows progressive deterioration with pipes now corroded at multiple points. The suspension system has recurring issues with bushes and dust covers, while the lighting system consistently presents headlamp alignment problems. The recent MOT pass suggests these issues have been addressed, but the pattern of failures indicates the need for comprehensive preventative maintenance. Given the vehicle's age and condition, prospective owners should budget for ongoing repairs to address corrosion and wear-related issues.
